intro: Erophila decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive erophila, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in dry climates.
